page.title: 14Wildlife.
page.content: The environment in our block supports much wildlife and plants. This is because of the variety of landscape such as sea and sea shore, woodlands, open fields, hilly areas and built-up parts. The Menai Strait provides living conditions for many varieties of fish e.g. cod,plaice, dog fish, eels, shell fish etc. The shore is a mixture of rock, pebbles and mud flats. Birds such as gulls, oystercatchers and puffins. The woodlands mainly consist of deciduous trees. Many of these trees, especially oak, grow on the banks of the Strait, and support both birds and animals. The most common birds are thrushes, blackbirds, robins, tits, magpies and chaffinches. Some of the animals to be found include rabbits, foxes, stoats and grey squirrels.
